results.title: South West Tasmania: The Gliders (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Catherine Millar, John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
The sheer challenge of remote wilderness is shown in this spectacular program of a group’s arduous trek up Federation Peak with the aim of hang gliding from the top. Young and old take part in the trek and viewers share in the thoughts, inspiration and differing goals of the group.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Catherine Millar, John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions

results.title: Kimberley: Wandjina country
results.creator_credit: David Morgan, John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
Part three of a series of six documentaries that examine the wilderness areas of Australia. Belinda Wright and Stanley Breeden are naturalists and photographers who work for the National Geographic Society. As they become fascinated with the “Wandjina” rock paintings, the viewer also gains some insight into the deep, spiritual relationship the Aboriginal people have with the land. A Teacher’s guide accompanies the video.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Morgan, John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions

results.title: Kakadu: Land of the Crocodile
results.creator_credit: David Greig, John Richardson and Kestrel Films (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
Wilderness is increasingly recognised as a scarce and vital commodity worldwide. In this video, Part 2 in a series of 6 documentaries, Val Plumwood, environmental philosopher and writer returns to Kakadu, where she was the victim of a terrible crocodile attack. Set against the steamy, intensely beautiful, backdrop of Kakadu National Park viewers share her thoughts on wilderness and wildlife. Accompanied by a Teacher’s Guide.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Greig, John Richardson and Kestrel Films (Australia)

results.title: Central Australia: tracks in the sand
results.creator_credit: John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
Cartoonist Michael Leunig records his impressions of Alice Springs, Ayers Rock and the vast emptiness of the Simpson Desert. Viewers are privy to a special meeting of minds and cultures, when he shares a canvas on the sand with Aboriginal artist, Michael Nelson. Accompanied by a Teacher’s guide.

group_works.title: From the Wet to the Top End
Stories of survival with Les Hiddins. [Part 1]
group_works.creator_credit: David Telfer, Richard Walker, Tim Clark and ABC-TV (Australia)

group_works.title: Stories of survival with Les Hiddins. [Part 2]
group_works.creator_credit: David Telfer, Jack King, Richard Walker, Tim Clark and ABC-TV (Australia)

results.title: Stories of survival with Les Hiddins. [Part 2]
results.creator_credit: David Telfer, Jack King, Richard Walker, Tim Clark and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Bush tucker man series”.
Les Hiddins travels Australia-wide tracking down stories of survival in the wilderness. “Gold Fever” looks at the legend of Lasseter’s lost reef of gold in Central Australia. “The Passionate Prussian” retraces Leichardt’s exploration from Moreton Bay to Point Essington and the mystery which shrouds his disappearance. “The Great Misadventure” looks at the ill-fated Burke and Wills expedition and how a knowledge of Bush Tucker may have changed the outcome. The final episode “Into the Vilest Country” features the Cape York Penninsula as Les travels to the area in a manner which contrasts that of the cumbersome Kennedy exploration.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Telfer, Jack King, Richard Walker, Tim Clark and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Bush tucker man series”.
Les Hiddins travels Australia-wide tracking down stories of survival in the wilderness. “Gold Fever” looks at the legend of Lasseter’s lost reef of gold in Central Australia. “The Passionate Prussian” retraces Leichardt’s exploration from Moreton Bay to Point Essington and the mystery which shrouds his disappearance. “The Great Misadventure” looks at the ill-fated Burke and Wills expedition and how a knowledge of Bush Tucker may have changed the outcome. The final episode “Into the Vilest Country” features the Cape York Penninsula as Les travels to the area in a manner which contrasts that of the cumbersome Kennedy exploration.

Episode number 12 of Series “Bush tucker man series”.
Les Hiddins travels Australia-wide tracking down stories of survival in the wilderness. “Gold Fever” looks at the legend of Lasseter’s lost reef of gold in Central Australia. “The Passionate Prussian” retraces Leichardt’s exploration from Moreton Bay to Point Essington and the mystery which shrouds his disappearance. “The Great Misadventure” looks at the ill-fated Burke and Wills expedition and how a knowledge of Bush Tucker may have changed the outcome. The final episode “Into the Vilest Country” features the Cape York Penninsula as Les travels to the area in a manner which contrasts that of the cumbersome Kennedy exploration.

results.title: Stories of survival with Les Hiddins. [Part 1]
results.creator_credit: David Telfer, Richard Walker, Tim Clark and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Bush tucker man series”.
Les Hiddins relates survival stories in four episodes. ‘The “Coffee Royal” affair’ set in Western Australia traces the story of Charles Kingsford Smith whose reputation was damaged by one of Australia’s earliest aviation disasters. ‘The Cannibal convict’ tells of one of the earliest convict escapees, Alexander Pierce in the wilds of south-west Tasmania. The footsteps of determined explorer John McDouall Stuart is retraced in ‘The Best of them all.’ ‘The Dutch settlement’ follows clues across Australia to investigate a report made last century about a Dutch colony established in Central Australia following a shipwreck.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Telfer, Richard Walker, Tim Clark and ABC-TV (Australia)
